segment.name: Beginning of message
segment.documentation: BGM, A segment by which the sender must uniquely identify the request for document by means of its type and number.

segment.name: Document/message details
segment.documentation: DOC, A segment indicating the type of document that is required, how many copies, and in what form it is required, e.g. EDI, mail, etc.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment specifying general dates and, when relevant, times related to the whole message. The request preparation date must be specified using this segment.

segment.name: Free text
segment.documentation: FTX, A segment with free text information, in coded or clear form, used when additional information is needed but cannot be accommodated within other segments. In computer to computer exchanges such text will normally require the receiver to process this segment manually.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 1: A group of segments for giving references and where necessary, their dates, relating to the whole message.

segment.name: Reference
segment.documentation: RFF, A segment identifying the reference by its number and where appropriate a line number within the document.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment specifying the date/time related to the reference.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 2: A group of segments identifying the parties with associated information.

segment.name: Name and address
segment.documentation: NAD, A segment identifying names and addresses of the parties, in coded or clear form, and their functions relevant to the request for document message. Identification of the sender of the request and the recipient is mandatory for the request for document message. It is recommended that where possible only the coded form of the party ID should be specified e.g. the sender and receiver of the report are known to each other, thus only the coded ID is required, but when a new address might have to be clearly specified, e.g. where the document is to be sent to a third party, this should be done preferably in structured format.

segment.name: Place/location identification
segment.documentation: LOC, A segment to identify a location within the above name and address.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 3: A group of segments giving contact details of the specific person or department within the party identified in the NAD segment.

segment.name: Contact information
segment.documentation: CTA, A segment to identify a person or department, and their function, to whom communications should be directed.

segment.name: Communication contact
segment.documentation: COM, A segment to identify a communications type and number for the contact specified in the CTA segment.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 4: A group of segments providing details of what information is required to be included in the document. There must be at least one occurrence of Segment group 4 within a request for document message.

segment.name: Line item
segment.documentation: LIN, A segment identifying the line item of the message by the line number and optionally identifying the product or service to be included in the document/message.

segment.name: Processing information
segment.documentation: GEI, A segment allowing the user to specify any special processing requirements, e.g. that all related documents are also required.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment identifying the date that pertain to the document, e.g. original date, required by date.

segment.name: Additional product id
segment.documentation: PIA, A segment providing additional identification of the product to which the document pertains.

segment.name: Item description
segment.documentation: IMD, A segment used to identify the product by free format or semi- structured description. Used when no appropriate code is available in the PIA segment to fully describe the product.

segment.name: Measurements
segment.documentation: MEA, A segment to describe the physical measurements of the required product, e.g. length, height, weight.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 5: A group of segments providing references, and if required applicable dates, pertaining to the above document.

segment.name: Reference
segment.documentation: RFF, A segment to identify applicable references to be included in the document, e.g. order number, certificate number.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment to provide dates/times applicable to the above references.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 6: A group of segments allowing documents to be individually addressed to either particular places, and or particular people within locations.

segment.name: Name and address
segment.documentation: NAD, A segment to identify other parties requiring the document.

segment.name: Place/location identification
segment.documentation: LOC, A segment to further qualify the above address.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 7: A group of segments to identify individual contacts relevant to the above party.

segment.name: Contact information
segment.documentation: CTA, A segment to specify contact person or department.

segment.name: Communication contact
segment.documentation: COM, A segment to specify the communication channel and identifier for the above person / department.
